channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Voices of experience and hope soar in a song to prevent suicide
item.description: "Hold the Hope" was sparked by one woman's experience as a caregiver to someone who survived suicidal struggles. It started as a poem that has become a film, a song and even a dance.
item.content:encoded: "Hold the Hope" was sparked by one woman's experience as a caregiver to someone who survived suicidal struggles. It started as a poem that has become a film, a song and even a dance.
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: Tanning bed users are at higher risk of skin cancer, especially in unusual places
item.description: Indoor tanning is trending among Gen Z. A new study finds tanning bed users not only have a much higher risk of melanoma, they also have DNA damage linked to cancer across nearly their entire skin.
item.content:encoded:
Indoor tanning is trending among Gen Z. A new study finds tanning bed users not only have a much higher risk of melanoma, they also have DNA damage linked to cancer across nearly their entire skin.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Gunmen kill at least 11 people at a Jewish event at Sydney's Bondi Beach
item.description: Hundreds had gathered for an event at Bondi Beach called Chanukah by the Sea, which was celebrating the start of the Hanukkah Jewish festival.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds had gathered for an event at Bondi Beach called Chanukah by the Sea, which was celebrating the start of the Hanukkah Jewish festival.

(Image credit: Mark Baker)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: US envoys arrive in Berlin for latest round of Ukraine peace talks with Zelenskyy
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner will meet Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday, as Trump grows increasingly exasperated by delays.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner will meet Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday, as Trump grows increasingly exasperated by delays.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With federal relief on the horizon, Black farmers worry it won't come soon enough
item.description: At the National Black Growers Council meeting in New Orleans, Black farmers respond to the $12 billion in tariff relief announced by the Trump administration and outline challenges farms are facing.
item.content:encoded:
At the National Black Growers Council meeting in New Orleans, Black farmers respond to the $12 billion in tariff relief announced by the Trump administration and outline challenges farms are facing.

(Image credit: Dylan Hawkins)
item.dc:creator: Drew Hawkins

item.title: The 'magic' of walking with grief
item.description: Walking with other people who are grieving a loss is one way to ease some of the pain and feel less alone.
item.content:encoded:
Walking with other people who are grieving a loss is one way to ease some of the pain and feel less alone.

(Image credit: Nancy Eve Cohen)
item.dc:creator: Nancy Eve Cohen

item.title: 2 killed and 9 injured in Brown University shooting, person of interest now in custody
item.description: Authorities were searching for a suspect described as "a male dressed in black" who fled after the Saturday afternoon shooting, and now have a person of interest in custody.
item.content:encoded:
Authorities were searching for a suspect described as "a male dressed in black" who fled after the Saturday afternoon shooting, and now have a person of interest in custody.

(Image credit: Mark Stockwell)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: United Airlines flight returns to Dulles airport after engine loses power during takeoff
item.description: Shortly after departing the Virginia airport on Saturday, the Tokyo-bound plane's engine cover separated and caught fire, according to the transportation secretary. No injuries were reported.
item.content:encoded:
Shortly after departing the Virginia airport on Saturday, the Tokyo-bound plane's engine cover separated and caught fire, according to the transportation secretary. No injuries were reported.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: After failure in the Senate, House GOP has its own health care proposal
item.description: House Republicans released proposed legislation late Friday that would not extend enhanced Affordable Care Act tax subsidies.
item.content:encoded:
House Republicans released proposed legislation late Friday that would not extend enhanced Affordable Care Act tax subsidies.

(Image credit: Kevin Wolf/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Skywatchers rejoice: The Geminids meteor shower peaks tonight
item.description: The Geminids meteor shower appears every December, but it will peak this year on Saturday, the 13th.
item.content:encoded:
The Geminids meteor shower appears every December, but it will peak this year on Saturday, the 13th.

(Image credit: Ye Aung Thu)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise
